New Records: Fakhar Zaman scored the fastest century (63 balls) in a World Cup match for Pakistan
Rachin Ravindra scored his third century in the tournament
Key Match Events: The match was affected by rain, leading to a DLS method win for Pakistan
Pakistan won despite New Zealand scoring over 400 runs
Fakhar Zaman and Babar Azam formed a 194-run partnership
Pre-Game Insights: The match was highlighted by the expected performance of key players like Ravindra Jadeja and Shaheen Afridi
Pakistan's focus was on building partnerships and utilizing the powerplay performance
Post-Match Reflections: Fakhar Zaman expressed pride in his performance and the team's resilience
Babar Azam highlighted the importance of partnerships and adaptability in tough conditions
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match saw high scores from both teams despite Pakistan's lower total
Pakistan's win moved them level on points with New Zealand
The match was significant in determining the semifinalists of the World Cup
Others: The match was part of Pakistan's four consecutive wins, a notable milestone
